alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 01 at 4:24AM CST until January 01 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Carroll, Crawford, Franklin, Madison and Sebastian. In Oklahoma, Haskell, Latimer, Le Flore, Pushmataha and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until Noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain with embedded thunderstorms will continue across parts of southeast Oklahoma and northwest Arkansas through the morning hours. Locally heavy rainfall will be likely in the stronger storms. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches will be possible, which could lead to flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
